@Geoffreytsmith @tgemiles of course infighting between bulldogs continues in Russia, but it does not negate anything i wrote on Alfa
@Geoffreytsmith @tgemiles Yakunin recently opened a think-tank in Berlin to act as Kremlin agent there, kept his palaces and assets from RSD
@Geoffreytsmith @tgemiles firstly, we never know for sure did he or not, they do it thru offshores, 2ndly Yakunin feels quite well
@Geoffreytsmith @tgemiles my main criticism- don't overlook total oligarchic dependence on Kremlin/FSB see my report https://t.co/ZEeadIAoUn
@Geoffreytsmith @tgemiles Alfa has done so many bad things to the West and in the West, yet they are still there
@Geoffreytsmith @tgemiles Alfa has successfully pedaled a myth in the West that they are private businessmen, Kremlin helps them in that
@Geoffreytsmith @tgemiles Richard Burt, Trump's speechwriter, is a conduit for Alfa and Gazprom in DC, no one seems to care
@Geoffreytsmith @tgemiles also 1990's do not matter now much, Putin had over a decade to compromise and bend over oligarchs, Alfa obliged
@Geoffreytsmith @tgemiles you are wrong: Aven and Putin date to 1992, when Aven shielded P from criminal investigation in St. Petersburg.
@Geoffreytsmith @tgemiles finally, one can argue LetterOne is a way to circumvent sanctions, Sechin overpaid Alfa c. $5bn, why do you think?
@Geoffreytsmith @tgemiles one more: Alfa would not be in the West in 1st place without Kremlin's support, approval: act as money frontmen
@Geoffreytsmith @tgemiles You miss nature of Alfa's dependence on Kremlin: of course Alfa will risk in the West, so much compromising stuff
@Geoffreytsmith @tgemiles The issue is: is Alfa tied to Kremlin or not, you support the myth it isn't contrary to multiple evidence 1/2
@russiamonitor @AndrewYorke1 Thanks, but my story is only 2 points out of 17. nothing personal here, i monitor all oligarchs and how they act for Kremlin, not only AAR
@russiamonitor @AndrewYorke1 Also Burt, Trump's speech writer and Alfa/Gazp lobbyist, comm-tes for Putin&Alfa in DC then Alfa Trump communication actually makes sense
@russiamonitor @AndrewYorke1 I agree we can disagree. Обойдемся без фамильярности))
@russiamonitor @AndrewYorke1 I do not know of any other major company having a secret dedicated server channel with Trump which cuts off when news break out
@russiamonitor @AndrewYorke1 on Trump - Alfa conn-n I agree not enough concrete evidence but all other indir. eviden. does show Alfa acts as Kremlin agent in the West
@russiamonitor @AndrewYorke1 I would be interested to know if you find anything beyond mere sleaze in my points
@russiamonitor @AndrewYorke1 NYT did not say one impor. thing: Alfa first denied any link then when faced with evid. reluct-tly agreed. That shift in position is telling
@russiamonitor @AndrewYorke1 sorry but I respectfully disagree. Trading oil with Hussein, getting Sechin/Putin's money to LetterOne de-facto circumventing sanctions, etc
@russiamonitor @AndrewYorke1 I also do not mean to argue but for me there is enough evidence not only on sleaze but that Alfa acts as Kremlin agent in the West
@russiamonitor @AndrewYorke1 My response was to your point on ties. As for servers, I find Slate article much more persuasive and detailed than poor overview by NYT
@russiamonitor @AndrewYorke1 Sorry to be punctual, but you originally said "laughable that Alfa is "tied" to Putin" not about direct Kremlin control. I showed ties.
.@juliaioffe You might be interested to learn these details and that such apologetic articles appear
@nahlaw Plus if you look at all links I list between Alfa and FSB/Kremlin, you could see that Alfa has been used for special operations abroad. 2/2
@nahlaw I am not an expert on servers but Slate article seems more detailed and persuasive than short account by NYT. Marketing computer??? 1/2
